column5: A group of four of us are looking to book a charter out of Bronte or Credit for later this month.  Any good experiences with a particular charter would be helpful. thanks

A buddy of mine works for Salmon Express and they do it up right....not sure if they do anything less than parties of 6 though....I'll check with him and get back to you  *edit* They will do 4, but it'll cost more.  My recommendation is only on their abilities and track record....not their price     And if you DO go...ask for Steve as mate...the guy is off the charts and will make sure you have a blast
Plenty of good skippers in Pt. Credit. See if Wayne Wilson (Fishy Business) has an opening. You guys will have a blast. Wayne and I go way back and I mated for him back in the day.
Did you try an PM pikeslayer?
http://www.fishing4tails.com/  Greg amiel  Got out with him a couple years ago in late august... 21 fish... Mostly big kings... Biggest was 28 and a handful of 22-26 pound fish...

talk to Wayne Andrews (Andrews Charters) out of Port Credit.  Wayne has been chartering for over 30 years and is a great guy.  He does a lot for the fishery in the great lakes, and started Port Credit Salmon and Trout Association. www.andrewscharter.ca
This is maybe out of the question, I never hire a charter before but just curious how much is a charter for a day for 6people??? (Lake O) anyone know?? Thnx

You could head down Bowmanville way and get out with Lloyd Daume - U and Me Charters. Not sure if he has his boat in Port Hope or further West up the "coast". He was talking Newcastle or Bowmanville to get closer to the new homestead he's on.
The one that pops up in my mind is lunker larry from another board. Ive heard him on the radio one monday morning and all I can say is this I think hes out of bronte area.
I didn't mention Wayne Andrews as his boat is a little big and spendy for a group of 4.
Go with Boomers in Bronte sent you a pm
